content.label: plain text
content.extracted_text:
Government of Gujarat
Department of Education
Resolution No.: PVS/102020/61/S
Secretariat, Gandhinagar
Dt. 23/08/2023.

content.label: title
content.extracted_text: Read:

content.label: plain text
content.extracted_text:
1. Letter of office of Commissioner, Technical Education, Gandhinagar dated 14/09/2022
Letter No:DTE/AK/Admission Rules/C (2)/2022-23/8027

2. Report of Admission Process Committee for Diploma to Degree Engineering/Pharmacy
(Second Year (Third Semester)) dated 23/08/2022

content.label: title
content.extracted_text: Introduction :-

content.label: plain text
content.extracted_text: Introduction :-

content.label: plain text
content.extracted_text:
The Committee has been formed by the Government to simplify the admission process for
Diploma to Degree Engineering/Pharmacy second year (third semester) and also to include
students who have passed Diploma from previous year in the admission process. According to
whose recommendations, the matter of allotting admission on the basis of common entrance
test was under the active consideration of Government for the purpose that
engineering/pharmacy students in diploma can easily get admission in second year (third
semester) of degree engineering/pharmacy.

content.label: title
content.extracted_text: Resolution :

content.label: plain text
content.extracted_text:
After consideration it is hereby decided to allot admission on the basis of Diploma to Degree
Common Entrance Test (DDCET) to eligible students for the second year admission process of
Engineering and Pharmacy in various State Universities from the admission year 2024-25. The
suggested procedure for Diploma to Degree Common Entrance Test (DDCET) will be as follows.

content.label: title
content.extracted_text: (A) Diploma to Degree Common Entrance Test (DDCET) Committee

content.label: plain text
content.extracted_text:
DDCET Committee is constituted to coordinate all day-to-day matters related to Diploma
to Degree Common Entrance Test (DDCET). Which will be as follows.

content.label: plain text
content.extracted_text:
1. Commissioner Technical Education (Chairman of Committee)

2. Joint Director of Technical Education ( Member Secretary (GETERS))
3. Member Secretary, Admission Committee -ACPC

4. Registrar, Gujarat Technological University

5. Officer on Special Duty - ACPC

6. Officer on Special Duty — ACPC

content.label: title
content.extracted_text: (B) Nodal Agency for DDCET Exam

content.label: plain text
content.extracted_text:
Gujarat Technological University will be nodal agency along with for smooth
conduction of DDCET examination. The University will have to work in
coordination of the DDCET Committee.

Registration for the DDCET examination shall be done on-line. And the result and
DDCET Rank of the current year will have to be declared online.

DDCET exam will be valid only for admission for that year. It will also have to be
given first priority in processing the vacant seats after the online round.

DDCET exam fee for candidates will be Rs.250/-.

Registration Fees for admission process will be separate.

DDCET exam will have to be conducted offline — Paper Based Test (PBT) at various
centers in the state.

content.label: title
content.extracted_text: (C) DDCET Exam Structure:

content.label: plain text
content.extracted_text:
DDCET registration process has to be done in the month of February of
corresponding academic year.

The examination shall be taken on Sunday of the month of March of the
corresponding academic year. However, the decision of Chairman of the
committee will be final on the said matter.

Nodal Agency, in consultation with DDCET Committee, will finalize the number
and location of examination centers.

The structure of the said examination will be as follows.

content.label: table
content.extracted_text:
Time
Duration in
minutes

Program Paper
Number Paper No. of question
Basi f Sci
asics 6 clence BH 100

and Engineering
Engineering Aptitude Test
and (Mathematics 50 100
Technology and Soft Skill)

(Two Hours)

Pharmacy Aptitude Test 50 120
BPH 02 (Soft Skill) (Two Hours)

content.label: plain text
content.extracted_text:
Two marks for each correct answer shall be awarded. For each wrong answer and
more than one attempted answer minus 0.5 (half) mark shall be added on
obtained marks. Unattempt answers will have zero marks. Based on final obtained
marks, the merit list will be prepared and corresponding rank shall be prepared.
This will be ease to prepare final merit rank.

content.label: plain text
content.extracted_text:
e Students having equal marks for merit rank of DDCET in the said examination will
be given priority as follows. (Key of Merit)

content.label: plain text
content.extracted_text:
oO 0 0

Marks obtained in BE 01 for Engineering and BPH 01 for Pharmacy

Marks obtained in BE 02 for Engineering and BPH 02 for Pharmacy

Lowest deduction marks (Negative marks) in the said examination

BE 01 for Engineering and BPH 01 for Pharmacy have the lowest cut off
marks (Negative marks).

BE 02 for Engineering and BPH 02 for Pharmacy have the lowest cut off
marks (Negative marks).

Date of Birth

content.label: plain text
content.extracted_text:
e Syllabus and sample question bank of DDCET for the admission year 2024-25 will
be uploaded by the said committee on the website of the admission committee
by the first week of November, 2023.

e Present method shall be followed for all subsequent years unless otherwise
changed.

content.label: title
content.extracted_text: (D) Candidates qualified for DDCET Examination

content.label: plain text
content.extracted_text:
e Students who have passed in Diploma from a recognized Board/University in the
state of Gujarat in that admission year as well as students who have passed in
Diploma from a recognized Board/University across the country for 05% seats
in Government Institutions (Candidates appearing in the last semester will be
eligible.)

¢ Candidates who have passed Diploma from a recognized Board/University in the
State of Gujarat in the previous year and seeking admission in Degree

e Students having Bachelor of Science and Diploma Vocational from a recognized
Board/University in Gujarat state as per provision of AICTE

e Students who have passed in Diploma from Board/University from outside State
as per existing rules.

content.label: plain text
content.extracted_text:
Further, regarding admission, action will have to be taken as per the admission rules of the
Government from time to time.

content.label: plain text
content.extracted_text:
These orders are issued in accordance with the approval of the Government dated 10.08.2023
on the file of the same number of the department.

content.label: plain text
content.extracted_text: By order and in the name of Hon. Governor of Gujarat State.

content.label: plain text

-/SD

Maulika Shah
